A few words about your hosts

To explain the story of Ward family it is necessary to go back a little. It is necessary indeed to go back to the middle of the nineteenth century, when an industrious and intelligent man called Sibert Ward, who had been head gardener at a grand place in Sussex and had married the cook, bought with his savings and hers a few acres north of London and set up as a market gardener.

  • Read the full story
.
.

Discover History of Villa Rosemary

There will be a great forgathering of English folk on the Riviera this Eastertide, for it is the statue of Queen Victoria is to be unveiled at Nice and that of King Edward at Cannes. Then, too, the harbour of Villefranche is to be the scene of a meeting of the fleets of the entente cordiale group, France acting as hostess to her Russian and English friends.

Even as the iconic venues come back to life one by one, the magic never stops at the Villa Rosemary
